image.altText: Ada under a blanket on the couch looking miserable, while a cat sits on her lap.

items.synopsis: Healthcare workers have warned the flu season has arrived early this year and is hitting young kids harder than usual.

title.children: Flu season has started early. Doctors hold fears for children amid low vaccination rates

image.altText: A glass of rum and cola.

items.synopsis: Opposition Leader Rebecca White grills Tasmania's premier over a promised million-dollar grant to a rum distillery with links to a Liberal Party staffer, which Ms White says should have been open to other businesses to seek.

title.children: Tasmanian premier denies conflict of interest in promised $1.2 rum distillery grant

image.altText: Philip Lowe wearing glasses and a suit sits at a table and speaks.

items.synopsis: There is one issue that stands head and shoulders above the rest as Philip Lowe's greatest threat in the battle to control inflation, writes business editor Ian Verrender.

title.children: The dark side of the property market rebound

image.altText: a woman looking at the camera and smiling

items.synopsis: Extensive scientific and medical evidence proved to be key to setting Kathleen Folbigg free, 20 years after she was convicted of killing her four children.

title.children: The science that unlocked a rare genetic mutation in the Folbiggs — and set Kathleen free

image.altText: a man wearing a suit standing in front of video and photo cameras

items.synopsis: The full findings into the Victoria Cross recipient's unsuccessful defamation lawsuit are now public, and outline Justice Anthony Besanko's reasoning. Here are five findings you may have missed.

title.children: The Ben Roberts-Smith judgement is 726 pages long. Here are five key findings

image.altText: Ben Roberts-Smith receives Victoria Cross

items.synopsis: The Ben Roberts-Smith verdict has reopened the wounds of a shameful period of Australian military history that demonstrates how the leadership of the ADF has failed, writes Mick Ryan.

title.children: The Ben Roberts-Smith verdict has shocked the military. But why didn't its leaders act sooner?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Pham Minh Chinh standing in front of a building with military and young Vietnamese children holding flags.

items.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says two Australian citizens who faced the death penalty in Vietnam have now been granted clemency.

title.children: Two Australians granted clemency from death penalty in Vietnam

image.altText: A man pans for gold while another man looks on.

items.synopsis: This Bougainville community is living on a literal goldmine, but some residents say that despite it being abandoned for decades, it poses a risk to their environment and human rights.

title.children: This Bougainville community lives on a literal goldmine. They call themselves 'the unfortunate ones'

image.altText: A selfie photo of a family of three: two smiling middle-aged parents and a 3 year old boy in the middle.

items.synopsis: The construction industry insolvency crisis is sweeping the nation, and it's devastating for both consumers and builders. So what can be done about it?

title.children: Michael has had to finish three homes after builders went broke. Why does it keep happening?

image.altText: woman looks lovingly at her chihuahua puppy who fits in her hand

items.synopsis: New laws require a landlord to give a reason for refusing a tenant's request to have a pet, like if the animal is dangerous or the property is too small for it.

title.children: Renter wins appeal to have a Chihuahua in test of Queensland's new tenancy laws

image.altText: A royal penguin with large yellow eyebrows preens its mate.

items.synopsis: Australia's federal environment minister signs off on plans to almost triple the size of the marine park off Macquarie Island — and the seafood industry's peak body have concerns about the process by which the decision was made.

title.children: Seafood industry flags 'concerns' over process of tripling Macquarie Island marine park in size

image.altText: a woman standing next to a man who is researching her

items.synopsis: The long-running legal dispute over the Edgecliff property, which Barbara and Ted Grimley co-owned with their daughter, is settled.

title.children: Melissa Caddick's parents ordered to leave $2.25 million Sydney eastern suburbs apartment

image.altText: A man looks to his left as he buttons his suit jacket

items.synopsis: Prince Harry's no-show at court on the first day of his individual case against a tabloid newspaper was "absolutely extraordinary", the newspaper's lawyers say.

title.children: 'Time wasting': Prince Harry misses court after celebrating Lilibet's birthday

image.altText: US Air Force F-16 fighter jets in the sky.

items.synopsis: US fighter jets cause a sonic boom across the US capital while scrambling to reach an unresponsive aircraft that ultimately crashed in the mountains of Virginia.

title.children: No survivors found after plane that flew over US capital and led to fighter jet scramble crashes in Virginia

image.altText: An aerial view of smoke from an explosive attack in a field.

items.synopsis: Russia claims to have thwarted a major Ukrainian offensive in the Donetsk region, killing hundreds of troops, while Kyiv accuses Moscow of spreading lies.

title.children: Russia claims it killed 250 Ukrainian troops while Kyiv says it is 'shifting to offensive actions'

image.altText: An aerial shot of derailed coaches after a train collision.

items.synopsis: At least 275 people are dead and nearly 1,200 more injured after a horrific three-train pile-up in the eastern Indian state of Odisha. Here's what we know so far.

title.children: India's worst railway disaster in decades has killed at least 275 people. Here's what we know

image.altText: A composite image with sepia tones of a woman's face, and four baby photographs.

items.synopsis: Kathleen Folbigg was no stranger to tragedy when all of her children died before their second birthdays. This is how someone once known as Australia's worst female serial killer was freed from prison.

title.children: Long road to freedom: Kathleen Folbigg's tragic life started well before her babies died

image.altText: Sherry Marshall, not smiling

items.synopsis: Sherry used to love smiling, spending time with her family and volunteering  but a lack of affordable dental care has changed everything.

title.children: Sherry can't chew, talk or swallow her medication because of dental problems she can't afford to fix

image.altText: A truck lays on its side after a head on crash with a car which killed a mother and four children near Kingaroy.

items.synopsis: The inquest is examining the cause of a collision on the Bunya Highway in May 2019, which killed two boys and two girls, all aged six and under, and their mother, Charmaine McLeod.

title.children: Detective believed crash that killed mother and four children was 'retaliation' against husband, inquest told

image.altText: A rare dwarf emu egg has been found on King Island

items.synopsis: In 1805 black swans, kangaroos, and the world's last King Island emu lived amongst the sweeping lawns of the Château de Malmaison in Paris. So how did this creature make it to an empress' garden?

title.children: How the last King Island emu died a stranger in a foreign land

image.altText: A woman outside a court building in handcuffs.

items.synopsis: Crystal Leanne Hanley is granted home detention bail to clean up her SA Housing rental property, which the prosecutor has described as being "unsuitable for human habitation".

title.children: Woman charged with daughter's manslaughter granted home detention bail to clean up 'squalid' rental

image.altText: a huge crocodile in a small pond

items.synopsis: The giant animal's birthday will be celebrated at its home on Green Island in the Great Barrier Reef.

title.children: Cassius is the largest saltwater crocodile in captivity in the world. He might also be one of the oldest on Earth

image.altText: A man stands in front of a lectern.

items.synopsis: A court hears that Richard Hayden used money that should have gone to clients for their home deposits to pay for luxury holidays and medical bills for his dying wife. It brought an end to an almost 100-year-old family company.

title.children: Real estate agent admits stealing from clients to give dying wife a good end to life

image.altText: Lauren Fried and Jock Zonfrillo pose together and smile for a selfie posted to Instagram

items.synopsis: The widow of chef Jock Zonfrillo speaks for the first time in a video posted to social media, telling followers of her late husband's Instagram account that she wished he knew how loved he was by people "all over the world".

title.children: 'Overwhelmed by the messages': Jock Zonfrillo's widow speaks publicly for the first time since chef's death

image.altText: CCTV still shot of a man in a green long-sleeve shirt running in an undercover space

items.synopsis: A man who had been jailed for assault is found two days after he allegedly ditched his handcuffs and fled from a Rockhampton hospital.

title.children: Tip-off helps police track down prisoner after hospital escape

image.altText: Sheep in pens on live export ship

items.synopsis: The ABC joins a two-week journey aboard a live export sheep carrier from Australia to the Middle East to observe what happens on a typical journey.

title.children: What's life really like for sheep on a live export ship?

image.altText: Humpback whale with swollen tongue

items.synopsis: Authorities have closed a beach on the NSW Mid North Coast as they work to remove the body of a 15-tonne whale.

title.children: Whale carcass washes up on popular regional NSW beach

image.altText: The main entrance of the Coffs Harbour Courthouse.

items.synopsis: The City of Coffs Harbour has been fined $20,000 after a judge found it was aware of its obligations to maintain its gas collection system, but failed to do so.

title.children: NSW council fined after tip management leaves stench over coastal town

image.altText: a generic photo of young girls in an afghan school

items.synopsis: An education official says two separate primary schools were targeted with an unknown poison.

title.children: Two separate poison attacks carried out against young Afghan schoolgirls

image.altText: Woman stands with her back against a wall painted in the colours of the Aboriginal flag

items.synopsis: There were high hopes that Macquarie Point would become a beacon for reconciliation with Tasmania's Aboriginal community but as the AFL stadium project gains momentum, those hopes are fading.

title.children: 'Grand vision hasn't been supported' as Aboriginal community project moves out

image.altText: A number of gold bars lined up and being stamped by a worker using a hammer.

items.synopsis: Australia's third-biggest gold miner, Evolution Mining, has approved a $250 million expansion of its Mungari operations near Kalgoorlie, despite concerns about the overheated construction sector.

title.children: WA gold mine set to double capacity after $250m expansion gets green light

image.altText: An ad for an Adelaide nightclub featuring a fake polar bear in a bra.

items.synopsis: An Adelaide nightclub has apologised for a social media campaign, condemned as "misogynistic", in which a free drinks offer was extended to patrons based on their breast sizes.

title.children: Bar that encouraged women to take off bras for free drinks apologises

image.altText: Adèle Exarchopoulos, a brunette white woman in pink top, and Franz Rogowski, a brunette white man in black top, dance in a club.

items.synopsis: In its 70th year, the festival program boasts almost 300 films — from international heavy hitters and award-winners to lesser-known gems and trailblazing debuts. Here are nine you can't miss.

title.children: Cate Blanchett as a renegade nun, Mark Ruffalo as a h'omme fatale': Sydney Film Festival highlights
